page.title: 10TYPICAL DAIRY FARM ASHPERTON
page.content: The farmer rises at 5.30 a.m. and the first milking session is at 6.30 a.m. The parlour accomodates twelve cows, chained around the neck and standing sideways in the big cubicles. They are given a cup of cake to encourage them to stand still then the teats are wiped clean to remove germs. A cup is put on each teat which sucks out all the milk. The milk is sucked along pipes and then into the tank to be cooled and stored. The milk is collected each day by tanker from Northern Dairies, Hereford.
